N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4.163 - Executive order no. 163: directing that the adjutant general order into active service the organized militia to assist civil agencies and authorities in nassau, suffolk, westchester and rockland counties, the city of new york and their contiguous areas in disaster recovery efforts

State Regulations
NOW, THEREFORE, I, MARIO M. CUOMO, Governor of the State of

New York, under the Military Law of the State, do hereby direct by executive
order that the Adjutant General order into the active service of the State, for
such period, to such extent, and in such manner as he may deem necessary, all
or any part of the organized militia to assist civil agencies and authorities
in the disaster recovery efforts necessitated by a combination of severe rain
and high winds which has caused coastal and inland flooding, the interruption
of essential public services and utilities, severe coastal erosion, the
destruction of flood prevention structures, and the disruption of vital public
transportation systems in Nassau, Suffolk, Westchester and Rockland Counties, the City of New York and their contiguous areas beginning on December 10, 1992. 1. Brigadier General Michael S. Hall, the Adjutant General, is hereby appointed commander of all personnel
ordered into the active service of the State. 2. Units and members of the organized militia
who shall perform State active duty by order of the Adjutant General will
immediately assemble at their local armories when so ordered, and will remain
assembled pending further orders as to their disposition by the Adjutant

General. 3. All enlistments, re-enlistments or voluntary extensions of enlistments which expire after

December 10, 1992, or during the period for which the members are currently
ordered into the active service of the State are hereby extended for the
duration of such duty in the active service of the State. Signed: Mario M. CuomoDated: December 12, 1992
